Do you mean that the otherway around, that the Southern Court was the one h=
olding out? The Northern Court (the imposters) were the ones who "won" and =
continued into the present day... the Southern Court (the real court) was t=
he court that allegedly disappeared. YES, we do know that the two courts al=
legedly merged back into one, however...=C2=A0the truth is that the souther=
n line=C2=A0was not given the authority... The=C2=A0101st=C2=A0Emperor was =
Shoko, who was=C2=A0the NORTHERN LINE son of=C2=A0of Go-Komatsu... this mea=
ns that the pretender Northern court actually never really did disappeared.=
 The Imperial line is thus still a pretender line.
=C2=A0
=C2=A0However, ma=
ny families to this day still maintain a "Southern Court Loyalty" (such as =
my family)=C2=A0 and ... even if only in philosophy, still maintain a "hold=
 out" ideology.=C2=A0=C2=A0 There is a little town called Ichinomiya=C2=A0 =
in north-west Aichi prefecture which used to a haven for southern court pri=
nces and southern court loyalists (and if you are still interested, many of=
 the supporters held land in Kawachi as well as in Owari). During WW2, one =
branch of the Southern Court descendents tried to lay claim to their rightf=
ul place, and while the imposter Northern Court acknowledged their claim as=
 authentic and issued a statement as such, they refused (of course) to ceed=
 the throne to them. 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0 I hope that answered your question.
